intro: Amsinckia praecox, commonly known as the early yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other flowering plants such as hibiscus and cotton. Amsinckia praecox is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
